Nicknamed ''El Pipita'' or ''Pipa'',{{cite web|url=http://www.canalenapoli.it/news-napoli/video-alla-scoperta-di-gonzalo-el-pipita-higuain-79155|title=Alla scoperta di Gonzalo "El Pìpita" Higuain|trans-title=Finding out who Gonzalo "El Pipita" Higuain is|publisher=canalenapoli.it|language=Italian|date=25 July 2013|accessdate=9 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20150310000320/http://www.canalenapoli.it/news-napoli/video-alla-scoperta-di-gonzalo-el-pipita-higuain-79155|archivedate=10 March 2015}} as was his father [[Jorge Higuaín|Jorge]], who was also a footballer, Gonzalo Higuaín was born in France, attaining Argentine citizenship in 2007, and now holds dual nationality.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/story/404406/higuain-to-choose-argentina-over-france-report|title=Higuain to choose Argentina over France – Report|publisher=ESPN FC|date=24 January 2007|accessdate=18 October 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.repubblica.it/rubriche/la-storia/2015/12/05/news/fratello_higuain_campionato_usa-128800562/|title=Higuain Federico, il fratello di un Dio minore. Ma ora c'è aria di rivincita|publisher=La Repubblica|language=Italian|date=5 December 2015|accessdate=20 March 2017}} He started his career with Argentine club [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]], before a transfer to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in January 2007 for €12 million. His time in Spain saw him win honours including three [[La Liga]] titles, and score 107 goals in 190 league appearances. He joined Italian side [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] for €40 million in July 2013, where he won the [[Coppa Italia]] during his first season. In the [[2015–16 Serie A|2015–16 season]], he scored 36 league goals, winning the ''[[Capocannoniere]]'' title and equalling [[Gino Rossetti]]'s 87-year-old record for goals in an Italian top-flight season. As a result of his goal scoring exploits in Naples, Italian champions [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] signed him for €90 million in 2016, making him the most expensive South American footballer of all time (until Neymar's transfer to PSG in 2017); his transfer fee was the highest ever paid by an Italian team (until [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]'s transfer to Juventus in 2018) and also the highest of a player transferring within any domestic league (until [[Kylian Mbappé]]'s transfer to PSG in 2018).{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36874091|title=Gonzalo Higuain: Argentina Striker joins Juventus from Napoli|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 July 2016|accessdate=26 July 2016}} He won domestic doubles in his first two seasons with Juventus, also reaching the [[2017 UEFA Champions League Final|2017 Champions League final]] with the club. In 2018, he was loaned to [[A.C. Milan]], and later in 2019 he was loaned to [[Chelsea FC]]. Higuaín has been a full international for [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] since 2009; he has represented the country at three [[FIFA World Cup]]s and three [[Copa América]] tournaments, helping them to second-place finishes at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]], the [[2015 Copa América]], and the [[Copa América Centenario]] in 2016. ==Early life== {{Quote box |width=27% |align=right |quote="[[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]], the Brazilian one, was the best at everything. He is the only player who I have watched on video and tried to imitate, but it’s very hard.” |source=Higuain on his idol growing up, Brazil striker Ronaldo.{{cite news |title="Ronaldo, the Brazilian one, was the best at everything" |url=https://en.as.com/en/2017/02/21/football/1487673113_083376.html |accessdate=10 September 2018 |work=As}}}} Higuaín was born on 10 December 1987 in [[Brest, France]], the son of the Argentine footballer [[Jorge Higuaín]], who was then playing for [[Stade Brestois 29]]. He is of Basque descent through his father.{{cite web|url=http://www.euskalkultura.com/espanol/noticias/el-delantero-uruguayo-diego-forlan-su-abuela-vasca-y-sus-deseos-de-fichar-por-el-athletic-club-de-bilbao|title=El delantero uruguayo Diego Forlán, su abuela vasca, y sus deseos de fichar por el Athlétic Club de Bilbao|publisher=}} He left France at the age of ten months and does not speak French, but retains [[French nationality law|French citizenship]] in addition to his [[Argentine nationality law|Argentine nationality]], which he successfully applied for in January 2007. Higuaín has two elder brothers, Nicolas and [[Federico Higuaín|Federico]], the latter of whom plays for [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) club [[Columbus Crew SC|Columbus Crew]] as a deep-lying forward,{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/nationalleagues/nationalleague=usa-mls-2000000103/news/newsid/210/340/2/index.html|title=Higuain: I’m not jealous of Gonzalo|publisher=FIFA.com|accessdate=18 October 2015|date=6 June 2013}} and one younger brother, Lautaro.[http://old.clarin.com/diario/2006/12/04/deportes/d-02001.htm Federico ganó el duelo de los hermanos Higuaín]. Old.clarin.com. Retrieved on 17 April 2014. ==Club career== ===River Plate=== Higuaín started playing in the youth teams and made his debut with [[Club Atlético River Plate|River Plate]] in a 2–1 defeat against [[Club de Gimnasia y Esgrima La Plata|Gimnasia y Esgrima (LP)]] on 29 May 2005.[http://www.canchallena.com/1193372-higuain-los-convence-a-todos Higuain los convence a todos (Higuain convinces all)] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226012709/http://www.canchallena.com/1193372-higuain-los-convence-a-todos |date=26 February 2012 }} canchallena.com, 2 November 2009, in Spanish. On 12 February 2006, he scored his first league goal in a 3–1 victory over [[Club Atlético Banfield|Banfield]].{{cite web |url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&CTID=29&CPID=68&pStr=Match_List&PLID=191762&ListType=9&TEID=543&Season=2005%20-%202006&mTEID=3375&t=3 |title=Gonzalo Higuaín All goals 2005–2006 (Boca Juniors) |publisher=Guardian Stats |accessdate=15 September 2010}} Higuaín ended the [[2005–06 Argentine Primera División|2005–06 season]] with 5 goals in 12 appearances.{{cite web |url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&CTID=29&CPID=68&pStr=Player&PLID=191762&TEID=543 |title=Gonzalo Higuaín Facts |publisher=Guardian Stats |accessdate=15 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101127204526/http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&CTID=29&CPID=68&pStr=Player&PLID=191762&TEID=543 |archivedate=27 November 2010 }} Following his [[brace (sports)|brace]] in the ''[[Superclásico]]'' [[Local derby|derby]] against [[Boca Juniors]] on 8 October 2006, River Plate manager [[Daniel Passarella]] declared that Higuaín had an "enormous future" and was "destined for superstardom".{{cite news | url = http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2006/10/09/sports/LA_SPT_SOC_River_Plate_Higuain.php | title = Passarella predicts River's 18-year-old Higuain has "enormous future"HIGUAIN is becoming one of the most dangerous strikers in the world | work = International Herald Tribune |date=9 October 2006 }} By the end of [[2006–07 Argentine Primera División|that season]], he scored 10 goals in 17 league matches. ===Real Madrid=== ====2006–07 season==== In December 2006, Spanish club [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] signed Higuaín for [[Euro|€]]12 million from River Plate. His debut came on 11 January 2007 against [[Real Betis]] in the second round of the [[Copa del Rey]] in [[Seville]]. His first league game came three days later, on 14 January 2007, against [[Real Zaragoza]] at home. Higuaín was involved in the creation of numerous scoring chances and in the assistance for the only goal, which earned Madrid the victory.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2007/01/14/spain/primera-division/real-madrid-club-de-futbol/real-zaragoza/389446/|title=Real Madrid vs. Real Zaragoza 1 – 0|publisher=Soccerway|date=14 January 2007|accessdate=4 February 2019}} His first goal with Real came on 24 February when the team faced [[Atlético Madrid]] in the [[Madrid derby]], the equaliser (1–1) at the [[Vicente Calderón Stadium]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2007/02/24/spain/primera-division/club-atletico-de-madrid/real-madrid-club-de-futbol/389502/|title=Atlético Madrid vs. Real Madrid 1 – 1|publisher=Soccerway|date=24 February 2007|accessdate=4 February 2019}} During his first season at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium|Bernabéu]], however, Higuaín raised some doubts over his performance due to his overall lack of goals. ====2007–08 season==== During the [[2007–08 Real Madrid C.F. season|2007–08 season]], Higuaín played inconsistently, although he finished strongly at the end of the season: He first scored a last minute goal to earn his team a victory in a 2–1 comeback against [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]], which allowed Real Madrid to be mathematically crowned Liga champions for the second consecutive year.{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/marcador/futbol/2007_08/primera/jornada_35/osa_rma/asilovivimos.html |title=www.Marca.com |publisher=Marca.com |accessdate=31 May 2011}} Four days later, he scored the third goal of a 4–1 thrashing of [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in ''[[El Clásico]]''. The goal was scored just 57 seconds after he came off the bench.{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/Barca/saca/hombros/Madrid/elpepidep/20080508elpepidep_2/Tes |title=El Barça saca a hombros al Madrid |work=El Pais |date=24 May 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2011}} ====2008–09 season==== In the [[2008–09 Real Madrid C.F. season|2008–09 season]], Higuaín was offered the chance to be a starter due to a serious injury suffered by [[Dutch people|Dutch]] striker [[Ruud van Nistelrooy]].{{cite web|url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/deportes/Higuain/Espero/lesion/Van/Nistelrooy/signifique/retirada/elpepudep/20081113elpepudep_17/Tes |title=Higuaín: "Espero que la lesión de Van Nistelrooy no signifique su retirada" |work=El Pais |accessdate=31 May 2011}} In August 2008, Higuaín scored the winner in Madrid's victory over [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] in the [[Supercopa de España]].[http://archivo.marca.com/futbol/2008/supercopa/index.html Supercopa 2008] Marca.com. Retrieved 25 August 2010 Shortly afterwards, he scored all four goals in a 4–3 win against [[Málaga CF|Málaga]]. Because of this, he started to gain international recognition and became one of the leading goalscorers of La Liga, alongside his Barcelona counterpart [[Samuel Eto'o]].{{cite web |url=http://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/2008/11/08/mardid_malaga_recap/ |title=Higuain, Eto'o both notch four goals |publisher=Sportsnet.ca |date=8 November 2008 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160315014049/http://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/2008/11/08/mardid_malaga_recap/ |archive-date=15 March 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} On 21 April 2009, Higuaín played very well in the match against [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] and scored the decisive goal in the last minute, giving Real Madrid a 3–2 victory which enabled the team to keep close to [[Pep Guardiola]]'s Barcelona in the league table.{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/higuain-casillas-especialistas-milagros/20090421dasdasftb_60/Tes |title=Higuaín y Casillas, especialistas en milagros – LIGA BBVA , Real Madrid 3 – Getafe 2 |publisher=AS.com |accessdate=31 May 2011}} Throughout the season, Higuaín was regarded as one of the most promising talents in world football in the wake of spectacular games and last-minute goals. He ended the season with 22 league goals[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/stats/topscorers?league=esp.1&year=2008&cc=5901 Spanish Primera División – Top Scorers – 2008/2009]. ESPN. Retrieved on 16 December 2010 and 24 in all competitions, around as many as established football stars including [[Diego Forlán]], [[David Villa]] and [[Thierry Henry]]. ====2009–10 season==== The [[2009–10 Real Madrid C.F. season|2009–10 season]] saw Higuaín become Real's top goalscorer with 27 league goals, 29 in total, being at the same time the La Liga's second-top goalscorer, behind only [[Lionel Messi]] and surpassing Swedish international [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]], as well as his Madrid teammate [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]. This season included him scoring his first two goals in the [[UEFA Champions League]] and his second [[hat-trick]] for the club. ====2010–11 season==== [[File:Higuaín se prepara para chutar.jpg|thumb|left|Gonzalo Higuaín during a match in the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] group stage against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]].]] In June 2010, Real Madrid extended Higuaín's contract until 2016.{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1193040487639/1330006888664/noticia/ComunicadoOficial/Official_announcement:_Gonzalo_Higuain_s_contract_extended_to_2016.htm |title=Gonzalo Higuain's contract extended to 2016 |publisher=Real Madrid |date=7 June 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110917100632/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1193040487639/1330006888664/noticia/ComunicadoOficial/Official_announcement:_Gonzalo_Higuain_s_contract_extended_to_2016.htm |archivedate=17 September 2011 }} On 23 October 2010, he scored Real Madrid's 5,200th league goal, coming against [[Racing de Santander]] in a 6–1 thrashing by ''Los Blancos''.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/match/47766/real-madrid-vs-racing/index|title=Real Madrid 6-1 Racing Santander: Cristiano Ronaldo Grabs Four In Rout For Los Merengues|publisher=Goal.com|author=David Schiavone|date=23 October 2010|accessdate=5 February 2019}} On 4 November of the same year, Higuaín scored the club's 700th goal in the Champions League.{{cite web|author=Champions League |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1716/champions-league/2010/11/04/2198075/real-madrid-striker-gonzalo-higuain-pleased-to-qualify-for |title=Real Madrid Striker Gonzalo Higuain Pleased To Qualify For Knockout Stages After Milan Draw |publisher=Goal.com |date=4 November 2010 |accessdate=31 May 2011}} During the first weeks of December 2010, Higuaín was diagnosed with a herniated lumbar disc, and Real's medical staff suggested that he should have it operated.{{cite news| url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/real-madrid-wait-for-gonzalo-higuain-injury-assessment-2150267.html | location=London |work=The Independent | title=Real Madrid wait for Gonzalo Higuain injury assessment | date=3 December 2010}} On 5 January 2011, Real Madrid announced he would finally undergo surgery at the Department of Neurological Surgery of [[Chicago]]'s [[Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine]] under the command of Dr. Richard G. Fessler, [[M.D.]]{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330033821843/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_will_have_surgery_in_Chicago_on_Tuesday.htm |title=Higuain will have surgery in Chicago on Tuesday |publisher=Real Madrid |date=5 January 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110414095901/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330033821843/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_will_have_surgery_in_Chicago_on_Tuesday.htm |archivedate=14 April 2011 }} The surgery took place on 11 January, and Higuaín was discharged from the hospital the next day following a successful operation.{{cite web |url=http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330035261223/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_discharged_from_hospital.htm |title=Higuain discharged from hospital |publisher=Real Madrid |date=12 January 2011 |accessdate=31 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110320135142/http://www.realmadrid.com/cs/Satellite/en/1330035261223/noticia/Noticia/Higuain_discharged_from_hospital.htm |archivedate=20 March 2011 }} He was expected to spend at least four months away from the field in the recovery process: two months spent to recover from the surgery and another two to train with the team, although he was able to make an early comeback. On 23 April 2011, Higuaín scored a hat-trick against [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] in a 6–3 away win at the [[Mestalla Stadium]], giving him eight goals in eight matches against Valencia. Higuaín also assisted two other goals for [[Karim Benzema]] and [[Kaká]] in that same match.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/48776/valencia-vs-real-madrid/report|title=Valencia 3-6 Real Madrid: Higuain bags hat-trick & Kaka nets double as visitors win nine-goal thriller|publisher=Goal.com|author=Daniel Quinton-Navarro|date=23 April 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} ====2011–12 season==== [[File:Gonzalo Higuaín 48609.jpg|thumb|Higuaín in a Champions League game against [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]] in February 2012]] On 2 October, Higuaín scored his first hat-trick of the season against Espanyol in a 4–0 away win,{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/%2012/spanish-football/2011/10/02/2693483/espanyol-0-4-real-madrid-higuain-hits-hat-trick-callejon|title=Espanyol 0-4 Real Madrid: Higuain hits hat-trick & Callejon nets against old club as capital giants edge to within a point of Barcelona|publisher=Goal.com|author=Ben Hayward|date=2 October 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} following it 13 days later with another in a 4–1 win against Betis.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/12/spain/2011/10/15/2712679/real-madrid-4-1-real-betis-higuain-hat-trick-the-highlight|title=Real Madrid 4-1 Real Betis: Higuain hat-trick the highlight as Jose Mourinho's side record comfortable win|publisher=Goal.com|author=Charlie Scott|date=15 October 2011|accessdate=5 February 2019}} Higuaín scored to put Madrid up 3–1 in a 4–1 win against local rivals Atlético Madrid in the Madrid derby on 26 November. On 31 March 2012, he scored his 100th Real Madrid goal in a match against Osasuna, also adding a second goal to make it Real's 100th goal for the [[2011–12 La Liga]] season.{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-au/news/4016/main/2012/04/01/3005516/osasuna-1-5-real-madrid-ronaldo-higuain-at-the-double|title=Osasuna 1-5 Real Madrid: Ronaldo & Higuain at the double & Benzema hits stunner as Mourinho's men make a statement in La Liga|publisher=Goal.com|author=Daniel Quinton-Navarro|date=31 March 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} In the league-winning season, he scored 22 goals, more than his teammate [[Karim Benzema]], and proved to be a vital player for his team.[http://soccernet.espn.go.com/player/_/id/67310/gonzalo-higuain?cc=4716 Higuain statistics]. soccernet.espn.go.com. 27 July 2012{{cite web|url=https://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46240&season_id=141|title=Games played by Gonzalo Higuain in 2011/2012|publisher=Soccerbase.com|accessdate=5 February 2019}} ====2012–13 season==== [[File:Real Madrid v Sevilla 10 February 2013 A 2.JPG|thumb|left|Higuaín attempting to dribble past [[Emir Spahić]] of [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] in February 2013]] On 29 August 2012, Higuaín scored the opener in an eventual 2–1 win against Barcelona in the second leg of the [[2012 Supercopa de España]], which secured Real Madrid its first title of the season.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/real-madrid/9507759/Real-Madrid-2-Barcelona-1-4-4-agg-match-report.html|title=Real Madrid 2 Barcelona 1 (4-4 agg): match report|publisher=The Telegraph|date=30 August 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} Higuaín scored first league goal in the season opener against Valencia CF, his favourite opponent; he netted the opening goal in the 10th minute in an eventual 1–1 home draw.{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/r-madrid-vs-valencia/268194|title=Jonas ruins Real opener|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 August 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} He scored again in the next match, a 2–1 loss to [[Getafe CF]] at [[Coliseum Alfonso Pérez]], which marked Real Madrid worst league start in 39 years.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/la-liga/9501656/Real-Madrid-lose-further-ground-in-La-Liga-title-race-on-Barcelona-after-defeat-to-Getafe.html|title=Real Madrid lose further ground in La Liga title race on Barcelona after defeat to Getafe|publisher=The Telegraph|author=Ed White|date=27 August 2012|accessdate=5 February 2019}} In Real's away match to [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]] on 28 October 2012, Higuaín scored twice and provided two assists in a 5–0 victory.{{cite web |url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/348430/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Five-star Real hammer Mallorca |publisher=ESPNFC |date=28 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130225020241/http://espnfc.com/en/report/348430/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=25 February 2013 }} On 23 February 2013, he scored his 100th La Liga goal as he scored an 88th-minute winner to secure a 2–1 defeat of [[Deportivo de La Coruña]].{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/us/en/report/348285/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5901 |title=Higuain downs Depor |publisher=ESPNFC |date=23 February 2013 }} On 1 June 2013, following the end of the team's last match of the season, a 4–2 home win over Osasuna, Higuain, who scored the opening goal, confirmed that he will leave Real Madrid after seven years.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/news/story/_/id/1465718/gonzalo-higuain-confirms-leave-real-madrid|title=Gonzalo Higuain leaving Real Madrid|publisher=ESPN FC|date=2 June 2013|accessdate=5 February 2019}} ===Napoli=== Due to Higuaín's availability, clubs like [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]] were keen to sign him. Higuaín was at the centre of much transfer speculation, with many newspapers linking him to a move to Arsenal before Napoli's president [[Aurelio De Laurentiis]] said that Higuaín, along with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] goalkeeper [[Pepe Reina]], had passed their medicals and that the Argentine had signed a five-year deal with the [[Italy|Italian]] club, with Higuaín joining for [[Euro|€]]40 million.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story?id=1506002&cc=5901 |title=Higuain and Reina pass Napoli medicals |publisher=ESPNFC |date=24 July 2013 |accessdate=24 July 2013 }} On 27 July, Napoli confirmed the signing of Higuaín, with the Argentine being assigned the number 9 shirt.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story?id=1508152&cc=5901 |title=Napoli confirm Higuain signing |publisher=ESPNFC |date=27 July 2013 |accessdate=27 July 2013 }} ====2013–14 season==== On 10 August 2013, Higuaín played his first match as a starter in a pre-season friendly against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], scoring his first goal for the club in a 2–1 win. On 25 August, he made his [[Serie A]] debut in a 3–0 defeat of [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]] on the opening day of the [[2013–14 Serie A|2013–14 season]].{{cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/soccer/news/20130825/napoli-benitez-serie-a.ap/|title=Napoli vanquishes Bologna in Rafa Benitez's debut|date=25 August 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=Sports Illustrated}} A week later, he opened his goalscoring account in a 4–2 win away at [[A.C. Chievo Verona|Chievo]].{{cite news|url=http://www.football-italia.net/SerieA/match/36993|title= Chievo 2 – 4 Napoli|date=31 August 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=Football Italia}} He followed this up with goals in Napoli's next two fixtures: wins over [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] at home{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2013/9/14/4730856/napoli-vs-atalanta-final-score-2-0-seriea-2013-14|title=Napoli vs Atalanta, Final Score 2–0: Rafa's reserves rescue Napoli|date=14 September 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} and [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] at the [[San Siro]].{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2013/9/22/4759446/ac-milan-napoli-final-score-result-report-goals-serie-a-2013|title=AC Milan – Napoli, final score 1–2: Napoli conquer the San Siro|date=22 September 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} On 18 September, Higuaín scored in Napoli's opening [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] fixture, a 2–1 victory over [[Borussia Dortmund]] at the [[Stadio San Paolo]].{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011762/postmatch/report/|title=Napoli hold on to see off ten-man Dortmund|date=18 September 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=UEFA}} He went on to score in home wins over [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]]{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011810/index.html|title=Napoli make their mark in Marseille|date=22 October 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=UEFA}} and Arsenal,{{cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011842/index.html|title=Napoli victory in vain as Arsenal finish second|date=11 December 2013|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=UEFA}} but Napoli failed to qualify from the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] despite winning four of their six matches. Roma|Roma]] in the semi-final of the [[2013–14 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]], taking the team to the final with a 5–3 aggregate victory.{{cite news|url=https://www.sbnation.com/soccer/2014/2/12/5405898/napoli-roma-2014-coppa-italia-final-score-result|title=Napoli vs AS Roma, 2014 Coppa Italia: Final score 3–0, Napoli set up Fiorentina final|date=12 February 2014|accessdate=15 April 2014|work=SBS Nation}} On 13 April, he scored his first hat-trick for the club in a 4–2 win over [[S.S. his first goal was his 100th goal in Serie A, making him only the second player after Zlatan Ibrahimović to score over 100 goals in two of the top European leagues in the past 20 seasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/juventus/111/blog/post/3249665/gonzalo-higuain-produces-a-9-10-display-to-help-juventus-see-off-ac-milan|title=Gonzalo Higuain produces a 9/10 display to help Juve see off Milan|publisher=ESPN FC|author1=Mina Rzouki|date=28 October 2017|accessdate=29 October 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/article/2017/10/29/higuain-brings-century-juventus-down-stuttering-ac-milan|title=Higuain brings up century as Juventus down stuttering AC Milan|publisher=theworldgame.sbs.com|date=29 October 2017|accessdate=29 October 2017}} Higuaín played a decisive role in Juventus's 4–3 aggregate win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the round of 16 of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]]. Milan|Milan]] on a season-long loan deal.{{cite web|url=https://www.football-italia.net/125650/official-milan-sign-higuain-caldara|title=Official: Milan sign Higuain, Caldara|publisher=Football Italia|date=2 August 2018}} As per the official statement of [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], Milan would pay a loan fee of €18 million to Juventus in the 2018–19 season; also Milan would have the option to outright buy Higuaín the following season for €36 million, payable in two installments.{{Cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/media/native/investor-relations-docs/comunicato%2002082018%20accordi%20con%20milan%20ita.pdf|title=comunicato 02082018 accordi con milan ita.pdf|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} ====2019: loan to Chelsea==== On 23 January 2019, [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] signed Higuaín on a loan deal for the remainder of the [[2018–19 Chelsea F.C. season|2018–19 season]], reuniting him with manager [[Maurizio Sarri]], whom he played under at Napoli during the [[2015–16 S.S.C. Napoli season|2015–16 season]].{{cite web|url=https://www.chelseafc.com/en/news/2019/1/23/gonzalo-higuain-completes-loan-transfer-to-chelsea?cardIndex=0-0|title=Gonzalo Higuaín completes loan transfer to Chelsea|publisher=[[Chelsea F.C.]] official website|date=23 January 2019|access-date=23 January 2019}} Five days later, he made his debut in a 3–0 win against [[Sheffield Wednesday]] in the fourth round of the [[FA Cup]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{cite web|url=https://www.goal.com/en-au/match/chelsea-v-sheffield-wednesday/report/e95luqqdgq97hrocavvwhhtuy|title=Chelsea 3 Sheffield Wednesday 0: Bayern target Hudson-Odoi nets on Higuain debut|publisher=Goal.com|date=28 January 2019}} On 30 January, he made his league debut in a 4–0 away loss against [[A.F.C. scored his first goals for Chelsea, a brace in a 5–0 home win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47011453 |title=Chelsea 5–0 He scored his first goal on his full debut, a 49th-minute strike during a 2–1 win over Peru on 10 October 2009. Following Argentina's qualification, Higuaín was included in the squad for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]]. He scored a hat-trick in Argentina's 4–1 win over [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]] in their second group match,{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/world_cup_2010/matches/match_18/default.stm|title=Argentina 4–1 South Korea|date=17 June 2010|work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |first=Jonathan|last=Stevenson|accessdate=17 June 2010}} becoming the third Argentinian to score a hat-trick in the World Cup finals after [[Guillermo Stábile]] in [[1930 FIFA World Cup|1930]] and [[Gabriel Batistuta]] in [[1994 FIFA World Cup|1994]] and [[1998 FIFA World Cup|1998]],{{cite news|author=Richard Williams|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/17/argentina-south-korea-world-cup-2010 |title=Argentina 4–1 South Korea , World Cup 2010 match report |work=The Guardian |location=UK |date= 17 June 2010|accessdate=26 June 2010 }} and the first player to score a [[hat-trick]] in the tournament since 2002. His goal in the 3–1 win over [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] in the second round took him to a total of four, sending him clear as the second-top goalscorer in the competition.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jun/27/argentina-mexico-world-cup-2010|title=World Cup 2010: Carlos Tevez drives Argentina to victory over Mexico|publisher=The Guardian|author=Paul Wilson|date=28 June 2010|accessdate=3 February 2019}} ===2011 Copa América=== Higuaín was a member of [[Sergio Batista]]'s Argentine squad for the [[2011 Copa América]] on home soil, making one substitute appearance and one start in the group as [[Carlos Tevez]] was preferred at centre forward; Argentina advanced in second place behind [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]]. He started against Uruguay in the quarter-finals in [[Santa Fe, Argentina|Santa Fe]], and equalised in the 17th minute by heading Lionel Messi's cross past goalkeeper [[Fernando Muslera]]; he later had another goal disallowed for offside. Higuaín scored in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]] after his shot had hit both posts, but Argentina lost the shoot-out 4–5.{{cite news|last1=Edwards|first1=Daniel|title=Argentina 1–1 Uruguay (AET, 4–5 pens.): Carlos Tevez penalty miss proves costly as hosts crash out of Copa |publisher=FIFA.com |accessdate=1 July 2018 }} ==Style of play== A hardworking striker and a prolific goalscorer, Higuaín is considered to be one of the top strikers of his generation,{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2015/jul/09/strikers-premier-league-gonzalo-higuain|title=Every club wants one but where have all the (good) strikers gone?|publisher=The ‘Higuain best around’|publisher=Football Italia|date=29 October 2015|accessdate=22 November 2015}} and is known in particular for his great striking ability,{{cite web|url=http://www.sscnapoli.it/Squadra/Gonzalo-Higuain|title=Prima Squadra – SSC Napoli|publisher=|access-date=14 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150212070151/http://www.sscnapoli.it/Squadra/Gonzalo-Higuain|archive-date=12 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} as well as his opportunism and clinical finishing inside the penalty area, while his height, eye for goal, and strong physique make him a dangerous aerial presence in the box. He also possesses good technical skills, and an ability to link-up with teammates, hold up the ball, and lay it off to other players. His intelligent offensive movement off the ball and pace in the final third of the pitch make him an offensive threat during counter-attacks, and also allow him to lose his markers and get on the end of passes, or create space for his teammates with his attacking runs.{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2440254.html|title=How brilliant is Juventus' Gonzalo
